RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the two vehicles: white Malibu sedan and black Dodge pickup truck

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol: border patrol agency noticing drop-offs on Farm-to-Market Road 2050; involved in the arrest of Defendants RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR. and IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.; had an agent stationed at the Freer immigration checkpoint
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.white Malibu sedan and black Dodge picku: vehicles involved in the smuggling operation
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Farm-to-Market Road 2050: road adjacent to the Border Patrol station parking lot where vehicles turned southbound and where drop-offs of undocumented individuals were noticed; used by smugglers to avoid checkpoints; primarily used by ranchers, oil trucks, and occasional small cars from a nearby wind farm
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Freer Immigration Checkpoint: location where Agent Trevino was stationed and conducted inspections; checkpoint avoided by smugglers; location where IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR. was transported for further questioning
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Hebbronville Checkpoint: checkpoint on U.S. Highway 359 avoided by smugglers; mentioned by Defendant as the starting point of his travel
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.U.S. Highway 59: highway where vehicles were inspected by United States Border Patrol and location of Freer immigration checkpoint; part of route used to avoid checkpoints
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.U.S. Highway 359: highway with Hebbronville checkpoint; part of route used to avoid checkpoints
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Highway 16: highway connecting to Houston or San Antonio, used by smugglers after avoiding checkpoints; accessible via San Pablo Road and Santo Nino Road; location of the traffic stop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Houston: city mentioned as a potential destination for smuggled individuals
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.San Antonio: city mentioned as a potential destination for smuggled individuals
